content: Vector databases enable efficient similarity search over high-dimensional embeddings, making them essential for modern AI and semantic search systems.
Endee provides scalable vector storage optimized for low-latency retrieval in large-scale AI applications.
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) combines external knowledge retrieval with large language models to improve factual accuracy and reduce hallucinations.
By grounding LLM responses in retrieved documents, RAG systems deliver more reliable and context-aware answers.
Endee supports embedding storage, similarity search, and metadata filtering for AI-driven applications.
The Endee vector engine is designed to handle millions of embeddings with consistent performance.
Endee can be used for semantic search, document question answering, chatbots, and enterprise knowledge bases.
AI teams use Endee to power recommendation systems and contextual information retrieval.
A typical Endee-based RAG pipeline includes data ingestion, embedding generation, vector indexing, retrieval, and response generation.
Endee integrates seamlessly with popular embedding models and large language models.
Efficient indexing strategies in Endee ensure fast nearest-neighbor search even as data scales.
Low-latency retrieval is critical for real-time AI applications, which Endee is designed to support.
Vector similarity search is a core component of modern AI systems such as semantic search engines.
Endee enables AI systems to retrieve relevant context dynamically instead of relying solely on model memory.
Using high-quality domain-specific data in Endee improves retrieval relevance and RAG output quality.
